Modules¶

Simulation¶

class biosim.simulation.BioSim(island_map, ini_pop, seed, ymax_animals=None, cmax_animals=None, img_base=None, img_fmt='png')[source]¶

Initializer for the BioSim class.

Parameters

  • island_map (str) – Multi-line string specifying island geography

  • ini_pop (list) – List of dictionaries specifying initial population

  • seed (int) – Integer used as random number seed

  • ymax_animals (int) – Number specifying y-axis limit for graph showing animal numbers

  • cmax_animals (dict) – Dict specifying color-code limits for animal densities

  • img_base (str) – String with beginning of file name for figures, including path

  • img_fmt (str) – String with file type for figures, e.g. ‘png’

  • ymax_animals is None, the y-axis limit should be adjusted (If) –

  • automatically. –

  • cmax_animals is None, sensible, fixed default values should be used. (If) –

  • is a dict mapping species names to numbers, e.g., (cmax_animals) – {‘Herbivore’: 50, ‘Carnivore’: 20}

  • img_base is None, no figures are written to file. (If) –

  • are formed as (Filenames) – ‘{}_{:05d}.{}’.format(img_base, img_no, img_fmt)

  • img_no are consecutive image numbers starting from 0. (where) –

  • should contain a path and beginning of a file name. (img_base) –

Attributes
animal_distribution

Creating a pandas DataFrame with animal count per species for each cell on island.

num_animals

Total number of animals on island.

num_animals_per_species

Number of animals per species in island, as dictionary.

year

Last year simulated.

Methods

add_population(self, population)

Adding a population to the island.

carnivore_island_map(self)

Generates a nested list of carnivore population within each cell in the map.

herbivore_island_map(self)

Generates a nested list of herbivore population within each cell in the map.

make_movie(self)

Create MPEG4 movie from visualization images saved.

set_animal_parameters(species, params)

Setting parameters for animal species.

set_landscape_parameters(landscape, params)

Setting parameters for landscape type.

simulate(self, num_years[, vis_years, img_years])

Simulation of the island.
add_population(self, population)[source]¶

Adding a population to the island.

Parameters

population (list) – List of dictionaries specifying population

property animal_distribution¶

Creating a pandas DataFrame with animal count per species for each cell on island.

Returns

df – The dataframe with animal counts per species for cell coordinates.

Return type

pandas DataFrame

carnivore_island_map(self)[source]¶

Generates a nested list of carnivore population within each cell in the map.

Returns

carnivore_map – A nested list with the number of carnivores in each cell.

Return type

list

herbivore_island_map(self)[source]¶

Generates a nested list of herbivore population within each cell in the map.

Returns

herbivore_map – A nested list with the number of herbivores in each cell.

Return type

list

make_movie(self)[source]¶

Create MPEG4 movie from visualization images saved.

property num_animals¶

Total number of animals on island.

property num_animals_per_species¶

Number of animals per species in island, as dictionary.

static set_animal_parameters(species, params)[source]¶

Setting parameters for animal species.

Parameters

  • species (str) – String with name of animal species

  • params (dict) – Dictionary with valid parameter specification for species.

static set_landscape_parameters(landscape, params)[source]¶

Setting parameters for landscape type.

Parameters

  • landscape (str) – String, code letter for landscape

  • params (dict) – Dict with valid parameter specification for landscape

simulate(self, num_years, vis_years=1, img_years=None)[source]¶

Simulation of the island.

Parameters

  • num_years (int) – Number of years to simulate

  • vis_years (int) – Years between visualization updates

  • img_years (int) – Years between visualizations saved to files (default: vis_years)

  • files will be numbered consecutively. (Image) –

property year¶

Last year simulated.

Island¶

Island Module

class biosim.island.Island(island_map)[source]¶

Island class. Superclass for all landscape types.

add_carnivores(self, animal, animal_list)[source]¶

Adds carnivores to the island population. Used for ‘adding_population’ method.

Parameters

  • animal (Carnivore) – Carnivore object to be added to the population.

  • animal_list (list) – List of animals to be added to the population.

add_herbivores(self, animal, animal_list)[source]¶

Adds herbivores to the island population. Used for ‘adding_population’ method.

Parameters

  • animal (Herbivore) – Herbivore object to be added to the population.

  • animal_list (list) – List of animals to be added to the population.

adding_population(self, population)[source]¶

Adds population to the island.

Parameters

population (List) –

List containing dictionaries describing the population’s location and population type.

Required format: ini_animals = [{ “loc”: (coordinate_x, coordinate_y), “pop”: [

{“species”: str(animal_species), “age”: age, “weight”: weight} for _ in range(number_of_animals) ],

}]

construct_map_coordinates(self)[source]¶

Construct the coordinates of the island map.

construct_vertical_coordinates(self, h_axis)[source]¶

Constructs the vertical coordinates for the island map.

generate_cell_above(self, x, y, list_of_nearby_cells)[source]¶

Generates cell above current cell.

generate_cell_below(self, x, y, list_of_nearby_cells)[source]¶

Generates cell below current cell.

generate_cell_left(self, x, y, list_of_nearby_cells)[source]¶

Generates cell to the left of current cell.

generate_cell_right(self, x, y, list_of_nearby_cells)[source]¶

Generates cell to the right of current cell.

generate_nearby_cells(self)[source]¶

Generates a list of cells near current cell. These cells are used for animal migration.

island_aging(self)[source]¶

Yearly cycle for aging. All animals on the island turn one year older.

island_cycle(self)[source]¶

Performs operations related to the annual cycle for one cell.

island_deaths(self)[source]¶

Yearly cycle for death. Checks for all animals on the island if the die.

island_feeding(self)[source]¶

Yearly cycle for feeding. All animals on the island attempts to feed.

island_fodder_growth(self)[source]¶

Yearly cycle for fodder growth. Fodder grows for all cells on the island.

island_loss_of_weight(self)[source]¶

Yearly cycle for loss of weight. All animals on the island loses weight.

island_migration(self)[source]¶

Yearly cycle for migration. All animals on the island cell attempts to migrate. Resets the ‘has_moved’ status of the animals afterwards.

island_procreate(self)[source]¶

Yearly cycle for procreation. All animals on the island attempts to procreate.

map_constructor(self)[source]¶

Constructs the entire map of the island.

total_population(self)[source]¶

Constructs a list containing all the animals on the island.

Returns

total_population_list – List containing the total population on the island.

Return type

list

Cell¶

class biosim.cell.Ocean[source]¶

Cell subclass for all ocean landscape types. Ocean landscape cannot be traversed and contains no food.

Attributes
carnivores_in_cell

Returns number of carnivores in cell.

herbivores_in_cell

Returns number of herbivores in cell.

Methods

aging(self)

Updates animal age for all animals in cell.

calculate_relative_fodder(fodder, …)

Calculates amount of relative fodder in a cell.

carnivore_nearby_fodder(self, …)

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for carnivores.

deaths(self)

Checks whether an animal dies for all animals in cell.

feeding(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to feed.

fodder_growth(self)

Replenishes fodder for current cell.

herbivore_nearby_fodder(self, …)

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for herbivores.

loss_of_weight(self)

Reduces animal weight for all animals in cell

migration(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to migrate if they haven’t already migrated.

nearby_relative_fodder(self, animal)

Calculates the amount of fodder in nearby cells.

procreate(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to procreate.

sort_population(population)

Sorts a list of animals by their fitness in descending order.

Ocean initializer.

Attributes
carnivores_in_cell

Returns number of carnivores in cell.

herbivores_in_cell

Returns number of herbivores in cell.

Methods

aging(self)

Updates animal age for all animals in cell.

calculate_relative_fodder(fodder, …)

Calculates amount of relative fodder in a cell.

carnivore_nearby_fodder(self, …)

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for carnivores.

deaths(self)

Checks whether an animal dies for all animals in cell.

feeding(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to feed.

fodder_growth(self)

Replenishes fodder for current cell.

herbivore_nearby_fodder(self, …)

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for herbivores.

loss_of_weight(self)

Reduces animal weight for all animals in cell

migration(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to migrate if they haven’t already migrated.

nearby_relative_fodder(self, animal)

procreate(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to procreate.

sort_population(population)

Sorts a list of animals by their fitness in descending order.
aging(self)¶

Updates animal age for all animals in cell.

static calculate_relative_fodder(fodder, animal_species, same_species)¶

Calculates amount of relative fodder in a cell.

Parameters

  • fodder (float) – fodder in cell

  • animal_species (Animal) – Type of animal

  • same_species (int) – Number of same species animals in cell

Returns

Amount of relative fodder in cell.

Return type

float

carnivore_nearby_fodder(self, relative_fodder_list)¶

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for carnivores. relative_fodder_list is a list containing the amount of fodder for each nearby cell.

property carnivores_in_cell¶

Returns number of carnivores in cell.

deaths(self)¶

Checks whether an animal dies for all animals in cell. Dead animals are removed from the cell’s population.

feeding(self)¶

Each animal in the cell attempts to feed.

Each animal eats in order of their fitness. The most fit animal eats first.

Feeding is different for herbivores and carnivores. Herbivores eat plant fodder and carnivores eat herbivores.

Whenever a herbivore feeds, the amount of available fodder in the cell is reduced accordingly. Whenever a carnivore kills, the number of herbivores in the cell’s population is reduced.

fodder_growth(self)¶

Replenishes fodder for current cell.

herbivore_nearby_fodder(self, relative_fodder_list)¶

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for herbivores. relative_fodder_list is a list containing the amount of fodder for each nearby cell.

property herbivores_in_cell¶

Returns number of herbivores in cell.

loss_of_weight(self)¶

Reduces animal weight for all animals in cell

migration(self)¶

Each animal in the cell attempts to migrate if they haven’t already migrated.

Migration is decided by amount of relative fodder in nearby cells. For herbivores, relative fodder is plant fodder. For carnivores, relative fodder is herbivores.

After an animal has migrated, its instance is removed from the cell’s population list.

nearby_relative_fodder(self, animal)¶

Calculates the amount of fodder in nearby cells.

Parameters

animal (Animal) – Either a class instance of Herbivore or Carnivore

Returns

relative_fodder_list – List containing relative fodder in nearby cells and cell type of nearby cells.

Return type

list

procreate(self)¶

Each animal in the cell attempts to procreate.

Each animal can only mate with another animal that is of same species and currently in the same cell as itself.

Each new born animal is added to the cell’s population.

static sort_population(population)¶

Sorts a list of animals by their fitness in descending order.

class biosim.cell.Jungle[source]¶

Cell subclass for all jungle landscape types. Jungle landscape can be traversed and available food is fully replenished every year.

Attributes

Returns number of carnivores in cell.

herbivores_in_cell

Returns number of herbivores in cell.

Calculates the amount of fodder in nearby cells.

procreate(self)

class biosim.cell.Savannah[source]¶

Cell subclass for all savannah landscape types. Savannah landscape can be traversed and a portion of maximum available food is replenished every year.

Attributes
carnivores_in_cell

Returns number of carnivores in cell.

herbivores_in_cell

Returns number of herbivores in cell.

Methods

aging(self)

Updates animal age for all animals in cell.

calculate_relative_fodder(fodder, …)

Calculates amount of relative fodder in a cell.

carnivore_nearby_fodder(self, …)

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for carnivores.

deaths(self)

Checks whether an animal dies for all animals in cell.

feeding(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to feed.

fodder_growth(self)

Replenishes fodder for current cell.

herbivore_nearby_fodder(self, …)

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for herbivores.

loss_of_weight(self)

Reduces animal weight for all animals in cell

migration(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to migrate if they haven’t already migrated.

nearby_relative_fodder(self, animal)

Calculates the amount of fodder in nearby cells.

procreate(self)

Each animal in the cell attempts to procreate.

sort_population(population)

Sorts a list of animals by their fitness in descending order.

Savannah initializer.

Attributes
carnivores_in_cell

Returns number of carnivores in cell.

herbivores_in_cell

Returns number of herbivores in cell.

Methods

aging(self)

Updates animal age for all animals in cell.

calculate_relative_fodder(fodder, …)

Calculates amount of relative fodder in a cell.

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for carnivores.

Replenishes fodder for current cell.

Reduces animal weight for all animals in cell

aging(self)¶

Updates animal age for all animals in cell.

static calculate_relative_fodder(fodder, animal_species, same_species)¶

Calculates amount of relative fodder in a cell.

Parameters

  • fodder (float) – fodder in cell

  • animal_species (Animal) – Type of animal

  • same_species (int) – Number of same species animals in cell

Returns

Amount of relative fodder in cell.

Return type

float

carnivore_nearby_fodder(self, relative_fodder_list)¶

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for carnivores. relative_fodder_list is a list containing the amount of fodder for each nearby cell.

property carnivores_in_cell¶

Returns number of carnivores in cell.

deaths(self)¶

Checks whether an animal dies for all animals in cell. Dead animals are removed from the cell’s population.

feeding(self)¶

Each animal in the cell attempts to feed.

Each animal eats in order of their fitness. The most fit animal eats first.

Feeding is different for herbivores and carnivores. Herbivores eat plant fodder and carnivores eat herbivores.

Whenever a herbivore feeds, the amount of available fodder in the cell is reduced accordingly. Whenever a carnivore kills, the number of herbivores in the cell’s population is reduced.

fodder_growth(self)¶

Replenishes fodder for current cell.

herbivore_nearby_fodder(self, relative_fodder_list)¶

Calculates the the amount of nearby fodder for herbivores. relative_fodder_list is a list containing the amount of fodder for each nearby cell.

property herbivores_in_cell¶

Returns number of herbivores in cell.

loss_of_weight(self)¶

Reduces animal weight for all animals in cell

migration(self)¶

Each animal in the cell attempts to migrate if they haven’t already migrated.

Migration is decided by amount of relative fodder in nearby cells. For herbivores, relative fodder is plant fodder. For carnivores, relative fodder is herbivores.

After an animal has migrated, its instance is removed from the cell’s population list.

nearby_relative_fodder(self, animal)¶

Calculates the amount of fodder in nearby cells.

Parameters

animal (Animal) – Either a class instance of Herbivore or Carnivore

Returns

relative_fodder_list – List containing relative fodder in nearby cells and cell type of nearby cells.

Return type

list

procreate(self)¶

Each animal in the cell attempts to procreate.

Each animal can only mate with another animal that is of same species and currently in the same cell as itself.

Each new born animal is added to the cell’s population.

static sort_population(population)¶

Sorts a list of animals by their fitness in descending order.

class biosim.cell.Desert[source]¶

Cell subclass for all desert landscape types. Desert landscape can be traversed and contains no fodder.

Attributes

adjust_weight_after_birth(self, new_born_animal)¶

Updates the weight of the mother after a baby is born.

Parameters

new_born_animal (Animal) – New born baby

aging(self)¶

Increases the age of the animal by one year and updates its fitness.

calculate_fitness(self)¶

Calculates the fitness of an animal.

Returns

Fitness of the animal

Return type

float

calculate_propensities(self, relative_fodder_list)¶

Calculates the propensity to move for the animal.

Parameters

relative_fodder_list (list) – A list of up to four nearby available cells. The list can contain any cells with invalid landscape types. (i.e. landscape that cannot be traversed such as mountain or ocean).

Returns

propensities – List of propensity values for each relevant cell the animal is considering to migrate to.

Return type

list

calculate_weight(self)¶

Calculates the weight of the animal. This is used whenever the class initializer for the animals did not receive any specified weight input.

Returns

Weight of the animal.

Return type

float

check_move(self)¶

Checks if an animal can move. This is checked every time an animal attempts to migrate.

Returns

‘True’ if the check is passed, ‘False’ otherwise.

Return type

bool

static choose_migration_destination(relative_fodder_list, propensities_list)¶

Calculates which cell the animal decides to migrate to.

Parameters

  • relative_fodder_list (list) – A list of up to four nearby available cells. The list can contain any cells with invalid landscape types. (i.e. landscape that cannot be traversed such as mountain or ocean).

  • propensities_list (list) – List containing propensity values for each relevant cell.

Returns

chosen_cell – The cell the animal choose to migrate to.

Return type

Cell

death(self)¶

Determines whether an animal dies. The animal dies if the fitness of the animal is 0. The animal also has a probability of dying each year.

Returns

‘True’ is the animal dies and ‘False’ otherwise.

Return type

Bool

feed(self, cell_fodder_info)[source]¶

Herbivore feeding. Each year, the herbivore attempts to eat an amount of fodder. How much the herbivore actually eats depends on the available fodder in the cell.

Parameters

cell_fodder_info (float) – Amount of available fodder in the cell.

Returns

eaten – Amount of actually eaten fodder.

Return type

float

property get_fitness¶

Fitness getter for animals.

Returns

Animal fitness

Return type

float

gives_birth(self, n)¶

Animals have a chance to produce an offspring each year. This is decided by their weight and the amount of nearby same species animals.

Gender plays no role in mating, and each animal can only give birth to one offspring each year at most.

After a successful birth, the animal loses weight equal to a portion of the birth weight of the baby.

Parameters

n (int) – Number of same species animals in the same cell.

Returns

  • bool – True if a newborn is successfully born.

  • new_born_animal (Animal) – Newborn animal.

loss_of_weight(self)¶

Calculates the amount of weight an animal loses every year, and updates the animals weight and fitness.

migrate(self, relative_fodder_list)¶

Animal attempts to migrate to one of the nearby cells. The movement is determined by the fitness of the animal and the fodder in the nearby cells.

The animal migrates only once per year, and the animal’s ‘has_moved’ status is updated to ‘True’ after.

Parameters

relative_fodder_list (List) – A list of up to four nearby available cells. The list can contain any cells with invalid landscape types. (i.e. landscape that cannot be traversed such as mountain or ocean).

Returns

chosen_cell – The cell the animal choose to migrate to. Otherwise returns None if the animal does not move.

Return type

Cell

probability_birth(self, n)¶

Calculates the probability of birth.

Parameters

n (int) – Number of nearby same species animals

Returns

Probability of birth

Return type

float

update_fitness(self)¶

Updates the fitness of an animal.

classmethod weight_check_for_pregnancy()¶

Checks whether the animal’s weight is above a threshold. This is required for the animal to potentially get pregnant.

Returns

Threshold value for pregnancy.

Return type

float

weight_gain(self, eaten)¶

Weight update after feeding. Currently used for herbivore feeding and carnivore killing.

Parameters

eaten (float) – Amount of relative fodder eaten.

Returns

Weight adjustment.

Return type

float

Calculates which cell the animal decides to migrate to.

fitness_greater_than_prey(self, prey)[source]¶

Checks if carnivore’s fitness is greater than the herbivore’s fitness, and not greater than a threshold.

Parameters

prey (Herbivore) – The animal the carnivore is trying to kill.

Returns

‘True’ if the carnivore’s fitness is greater than the herbivore’s, and not greater than ‘DeltaPhiMax’ threshold. ‘False’ otherwise.

Return type

bool

property get_fitness¶

Fitness getter for animals.

Returns

Animal fitness

Return type

float

gives_birth(self, n)¶

Animals have a chance to produce an offspring each year. This is decided by their weight and the amount of nearby same species animals.

Gender plays no role in mating, and each animal can only give birth to one offspring each year at most.

After a successful birth, the animal loses weight equal to a portion of the birth weight of the baby.

Parameters

n (int) – Number of same species animals in the same cell.

Returns

  • bool – True if a newborn is successfully born.

  • new_born_animal (Animal) – Newborn animal.

kill(self, nearby_herbivores)[source]¶

Carnivore attempts to kill a nearby herbivore. If the carnivore successfully kills the nearby herbivore, the carnivore’s weight is updated and its fitness is re-evaluated.

The carnivore continues to kill nearby herbivores until it is full or there are no more nearby herbivores.

Parameters

nearby_herbivores (list) – List of herbivores residing in same cell as the carnivore.

Returns

killed_herbivore – List containing all herbivores that was killed by the carnivore.

Return type

list

loss_of_weight(self)¶

Calculates the amount of weight an animal loses every year, and updates the animals weight and fitness.

migrate(self, relative_fodder_list)¶

Animal attempts to migrate to one of the nearby cells. The movement is determined by the fitness of the animal and the fodder in the nearby cells.

The animal migrates only once per year, and the animal’s ‘has_moved’ status is updated to ‘True’ after.

Parameters

relative_fodder_list (List) – A list of up to four nearby available cells. The list can contain any cells with invalid landscape types. (i.e. landscape that cannot be traversed such as mountain or ocean).

Returns

chosen_cell – The cell the animal choose to migrate to. Otherwise returns None if the animal does not move.

Return type

Cell

probability_birth(self, n)¶

Calculates the probability of birth.

Parameters

n (int) – Number of nearby same species animals

Returns

Probability of birth

Return type

float

Updates the fitness of an animal.

Checks whether the animal’s weight is above a threshold. This is required for the animal to potentially get pregnant.

Threshold value for pregnancy.
